headline: Accused shooter will get second opinion on competency evaluation | Crime | abc12.com

annotations.paragraph: Amarion Cain will receive a second opinion on his competency evaluation as he is accused of killing 17-year-old Khamani Lindsey in the Beecher area last summer.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides new information about the accused shooter receiving a second opinion on his competency evaluation.

annotations.paragraph: GENESEE COUNTY, Mich. (WJRT) - The man accused of killing 17-year-old Khamani Lindsey in the Beecher area last summer will receive a second opinion on his competency evaluation.
annotations.reason: This paragraph repeats information already provided about the second opinion on the competency evaluation.

annotations.paragraph: Amarion Cain, who was 18 at the time of the shooting, allegedly killed Lindsey in front of a Mount Morris Township home last June.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the alleged crime, contributing to the narrative.

annotations.paragraph: U.S. Marshals arrested Cain in Lima, Ohio, in August, and he was extradited back to Flint.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about the arrest and extradition of the accused.

annotations.paragraph: On Wednesday, Cain's attorney requested a second opinion on his mental competency exam, and the judge agreed.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides new information about the legal proceedings related to the accused shooter.

annotations.paragraph: He is due back in court in June.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about the timeline of the legal proceedings.

annotations.paragraph: If found competent for trial, Cain faces an open murder charge, two counts of assault with intent to murder, and several other firearm-related charges.
annotations.reason: This paragraph outlines the potential charges Cain faces, which is directly relevant to the case.
